cobblemon.species.dachsbun.desc: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
cobblemon.species.smoliv.name: Смолив
cobblemon.species.smoliv.desc: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
cobblemon.species.dolliv.name: Доллив
cobblemon.species.dolliv.desc: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
cobblemon.species.arboliva.name: Арболива
cobblemon.species.arboliva.desc: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.squawkabilly.name: Сквокабилли
cobblemon.species.nacli.name: Накли
cobblemon.species.nacli.desc: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
cobblemon.species.naclstack.name: Наклстак
cobblemon.species.naclstack.desc: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.
cobblemon.species.garganacl.name: Гарганакл
cobblemon.species.garganacl.desc: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
cobblemon.species.charcadet.name: Чаркадет
cobblemon.species.charcadet.desc: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
cobblemon.species.armarouge.name: Армаруж
cobblemon.species.armarouge.desc: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
cobblemon.species.ceruledge.name: Серуледж
cobblemon.species.ceruledge.desc: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
cobblemon.species.tadbulb.name: Тадбал
cobblemon.species.tadbulb.desc: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
cobblemon.species.bellibolt.name: Беллиболт
cobblemon.species.bellibolt.desc: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
cobblemon.species.wattrel.name: Ваттрел
cobblemon.species.wattrel.desc: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
cobblemon.species.kilowattrel.name: Киловаттрел
cobblemon.species.kilowattrel.desc: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
cobblemon.species.maschiff.name: Масчифф
cobblemon.species.maschiff.desc: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff’s face.
cobblemon.species.mabosstiff.name: Мабосстифф
cobblemon.species.mabosstiff.desc: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
cobblemon.species.shroodle.name: Шрудл
cobblemon.species.shroodle.desc: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
cobblemon.species.grafaiai.name: Графайай
cobblemon.species.grafaiai.desc: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
cobblemon.species.bramblin.name: Брэмблин
cobblemon.species.bramblin.desc: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.brambleghast.name: Брэмблгаст
cobblemon.species.brambleghast.desc: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
cobblemon.species.toedscool.name: Тодскул
cobblemon.species.toedscool.desc: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
cobblemon.species.toedscruel.name: Тодскрул
cobblemon.species.toedscruel.desc: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
cobblemon.species.klawf.name: Клоф
cobblemon.species.klawf.desc: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
cobblemon.species.capsakid.name: Капсакид
cobblemon.species.capsakid.desc: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
cobblemon.species.scovillain.name: Сковиллэн
cobblemon.species.scovillain.desc: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
cobblemon.species.rellor.name: Реллор
cobblemon.species.rellor.desc: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
cobblemon.species.rabsca.name: Рабска
cobblemon.species.rabsca.desc: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
cobblemon.species.flittle.name: Флиттл
cobblemon.species.flittle.desc: Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.
cobblemon.species.espathra.name: Эспатра
cobblemon.species.espathra.desc: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
cobblemon.species.tinkatink.name: Тинкатинк
cobblemon.species.tinkatink.desc: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
cobblemon.species.tinkatuff.name: Тинкатафф
cobblemon.species.tinkatuff.desc: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
cobblemon.species.tinkaton.name: Тинкатон
cobblemon.species.tinkaton.desc: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
cobblemon.species.wiglett.name: Виглетт
cobblemon.species.wiglett.desc: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
cobblemon.species.wugtrio.name: Вагтрио
cobblemon.species.wugtrio.desc: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
cobblemon.species.bombirdier.name: Бомбирдир
cobblemon.species.bombirdier.desc: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
cobblemon.species.finizen.name: Финизен
cobblemon.species.finizen.desc: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
cobblemon.species.palafin.name: Палафин
cobblemon.species.varoom.name: Варум
cobblemon.species.varoom.desc: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
cobblemon.species.revavroom.name: Реваврум
cobblemon.species.revavroom.desc: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.
cobblemon.species.cyclizar.name: Сайклизар
cobblemon.species.cyclizar.desc: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
cobblemon.species.orthworm.name: Ортворм
cobblemon.species.orthworm.desc: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
cobblemon.species.glimmet.name: Глиммет
cobblemon.species.glimmet.desc: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
cobblemon.species.glimmora.name: Глиммора
cobblemon.species.glimmora.desc: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
cobblemon.species.greavard.name: Гривард
cobblemon.species.greavard.desc: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.houndstone.name: Хаундстоун
cobblemon.species.houndstone.desc: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
cobblemon.species.flamigo.name: Фламиго
cobblemon.species.flamigo.desc: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
cobblemon.species.cetoddle.name: Сетоддл
cobblemon.species.cetoddle.desc: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
cobblemon.species.cetitan.name: Сетайтн
cobblemon.species.cetitan.desc: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
cobblemon.species.veluza.name: Велуза
cobblemon.species.veluza.desc: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
cobblemon.species.dondozo.name: Дондозо
cobblemon.species.dondozo.desc: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
cobblemon.species.tatsugiri.name: Тацугири
cobblemon.species.annihilape.name: Аннигилейп
cobblemon.species.annihilape.desc: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
cobblemon.species.clodsire.name: Клодсайр
cobblemon.species.clodsire.desc: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.
cobblemon.species.farigiraf.name: Фариджираф
cobblemon.species.farigiraf.desc: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.
cobblemon.species.dudunsparce.name: Даданспарс
cobblemon.species.kingambit.name: Кингамбит
cobblemon.species.kingambit.desc: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
cobblemon.species.greattusk.name: Великий Бивень
cobblemon.species.greattusk.desc: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
cobblemon.species.screamtail.name: Кричащий Хвост
cobblemon.species.screamtail.desc: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
cobblemon.species.brutebonnet.name: Грубый Чепец
cobblemon.species.brutebonnet.desc: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.fluttermane.name: Пархающая Грива
cobblemon.species.fluttermane.desc: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
cobblemon.species.slitherwing.name: Скользящее Крыло
cobblemon.species.slitherwing.desc: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
cobblemon.species.sandyshocks.name: Песчаный Шок
cobblemon.species.sandyshocks.desc: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
cobblemon.species.irontreads.name: Железные Гусеницы
cobblemon.species.irontreads.desc: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
cobblemon.species.ironbundle.name: Железный Мешок
cobblemon.species.ironbundle.desc: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
cobblemon.species.ironhands.name: Железные Руки
cobblemon.species.ironhands.desc: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
cobblemon.species.ironjugulis.name: Железная Шея
cobblemon.species.ironjugulis.desc: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
cobblemon.species.ironmoth.name: Железная Моль
cobblemon.species.ironmoth.desc: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
cobblemon.species.ironthorns.name: Железные Колючки
cobblemon.species.ironthorns.desc: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
cobblemon.species.frigibax.name: Фриджибакс
cobblemon.species.frigibax.desc: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
cobblemon.species.arctibax.name: Арктибакс
cobblemon.species.arctibax.desc: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
cobblemon.species.baxcalibur.name: Бакскалибур
cobblemon.species.baxcalibur.desc: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
cobblemon.species.gimmighoul.name: Гиммигул
cobblemon.species.gholdengo.name: Голденго
cobblemon.species.gholdengo.desc: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
cobblemon.species.wochien.name: Во-Чьен
cobblemon.species.wochien.desc: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.chienpao.name: Чьен-Пао
cobblemon.species.chienpao.desc: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
cobblemon.species.tinglu.name: Тинг-Лу
cobblemon.species.tinglu.desc: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.chiyu.name: Чи-Ю
cobblemon.species.chiyu.desc: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
cobblemon.species.roaringmoon.name: Рычащая Луна
cobblemon.species.roaringmoon.desc: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
cobblemon.species.ironvaliant.name: Железная Доблесть
cobblemon.species.ironvaliant.desc: It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
cobblemon.species.koraidon.name: Корайдон
cobblemon.species.miraidon.name: Мирайдон
cobblemon.species.walkingwake.name: Ходящая Волна
cobblemon.species.ironleaves.name: Железные Листья
cobblemon.species.dipplin.name: Дипплин
cobblemon.species.dipplin.desc: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokémon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.
cobblemon.species.poltchageist.name: Полчагайст
cobblemon.species.poltchageist.desc: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.sinistcha.name: Синисча
cobblemon.species.sinistcha.desc: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.
cobblemon.species.okidogi.name: Окидоги
cobblemon.species.okidogi.desc: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.
cobblemon.species.munkidori.name: Манкидори
cobblemon.species.munkidori.desc: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.
cobblemon.species.fezandipiti.name: Фезандипити
cobblemon.species.fezandipiti.desc: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.
cobblemon.species.ogerpon.name: Огерпон
cobblemon.species.ogerpon.desc: This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.
cobblemon.species.archaludon.name: Архалудон
cobblemon.species.archaludon.desc: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.
cobblemon.species.hydrapple.name: Хайдраппл
cobblemon.species.hydrapple.desc: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.
cobblemon.species.gougingfire.name: Давящий Огонь
cobblemon.species.gougingfire.desc: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.
cobblemon.species.ragingbolt.name: Бушующая Молния
cobblemon.species.ragingbolt.desc: It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.
cobblemon.species.ironboulder.name: Железный Булыжник
cobblemon.species.ironboulder.desc: It was named after a mysterious object recorded in an old book. Its body seems to be metallic.
cobblemon.species.ironcrown.name: Железная Корона
cobblemon.species.ironcrown.desc: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.
cobblemon.species.terapagos.name: Терапагос
cobblemon.species.terapagos.desc: It's thought that this Pokémon lived in ancient Paldea until it got caught in seismic shifts and went extinct.
cobblemon.ability.adaptability.desc: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.aerilate.desc: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.aftermath.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.
cobblemon.ability.analytic.desc: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
cobblemon.ability.angerpoint.desc: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.angershell.desc: When this Pokemon has more than 1/2 its maximum HP and takes damage from an attack bringing it to 1/2 or less of its maximum HP, its Attack, Special Attack, and Speed are raised by 1 stage, and its Defense and Special Defense are lowered by 1 stage. This effect applies after all hits from a multi-hit move. This effect is prevented if the move had a secondary effect removed by the Sheer Force Ability.
cobblemon.ability.anticipation.desc: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.
cobblemon.ability.armortail.desc: Priority moves used by opposing Pokemon targeting this Pokemon or its allies are prevented from having an effect.
cobblemon.ability.aromaveil.desc: Protects itself and its allies from attacks that limit their move choices.
cobblemon.ability.asoneglastrier.desc: This Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex’s Unnerve Ability and Glastrier’s Chilling Neigh Ability.
cobblemon.ability.asonespectrier.desc: This Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex’s Unnerve Ability and Spectrier’s Grim Neigh Ability.
cobblemon.ability.aurabreak.desc: The effects of “Aura” Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.
cobblemon.ability.baddreams.desc: Reduces the HP of sleeping opposing Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.ballfetch.desc: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.
cobblemon.ability.battery.desc: Powers up ally Pokémon’s special moves.
cobblemon.ability.battlearmor.desc: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
cobblemon.ability.battlebond.desc: Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the Pokémon’s bond with its Trainer, and it becomes Ash-Greninja. Water Shuriken gets more powerful.
cobblemon.ability.beadsofruin.desc: The Special Defense stat of all other active Pokemon is multiplied by 0.75.
cobblemon.ability.beastboost.desc: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.berserk.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.
cobblemon.ability.bigpecks.desc: Protects the Pokémon from Defense-lowering effects.
cobblemon.ability.blaze.desc: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.
cobblemon.ability.bulletproof.desc: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.
cobblemon.ability.cheekpouch.desc: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.
cobblemon.ability.chillingneigh.desc: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.chlorophyll.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.
cobblemon.ability.clearbody.desc: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.
cobblemon.ability.colorchange.desc: The Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the move used on it.
cobblemon.ability.comatose.desc: It’s always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up.
cobblemon.ability.commander.desc: If this Pokemon is a Tatsugiri and a Dondozo is an active ally, this Pokemon goes into the Dondozo's mouth. The Dondozo has its Attack, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, and Special Defense raised by 2 stages. During the effect, the Dondozo cannot be switched out, this Pokemon cannot select an action, and attacks targeted at this Pokemon will be avoided but it will still take indirect damage. If this Pokemon faints during the effect, a Pokemon can be switched in as a replacement but the Dondozo remains unable to be switched out. If the Dondozo faints during the effect, this Pokemon regains the ability to select an action.
cobblemon.ability.competitive.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.
cobblemon.ability.compoundeyes.desc: The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.
cobblemon.ability.contrary.desc: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.
cobblemon.ability.corrosion.desc: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it’s a Steel or Poison type.
cobblemon.ability.costar.desc: On switch-in, this Pokemon copies all of its ally's stat stage changes.
cobblemon.ability.cottondown.desc: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.
cobblemon.ability.cudchew.desc: If this Pokemon eats a Berry, it will eat that Berry again at the end of the next turn.
cobblemon.ability.curiousmedicine.desc: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it scatters medicine from its shell, which removes all stat changes from allies.
cobblemon.ability.cursedbody.desc: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.cutecharm.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.
cobblemon.ability.damp.desc: Prevents the use of explosive moves, such as Self-Destruct, by dampening its surroundings.
cobblemon.ability.dancer.desc: When another Pokémon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed.
cobblemon.ability.darkaura.desc: Powers up each Pokémon’s Dark-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.dauntlessshield.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.dazzling.desc: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
cobblemon.ability.defeatist.desc: Halves the Pokémon’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.
cobblemon.ability.defiant.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
cobblemon.ability.deltastream.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type’s weaknesses.
cobblemon.ability.desolateland.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.
cobblemon.ability.disguise.desc: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.
cobblemon.ability.download.desc: Compares an opposing Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.
cobblemon.ability.drizzle.desc: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.drought.desc: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.dryskin.desc: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.earlybird.desc: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.eartheater.desc: This Pokemon is immune to Ground-type moves and restores 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, when hit by a Ground-type move.
cobblemon.ability.effectspore.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker.
cobblemon.ability.electricsurge.desc: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.electromorphosis.desc: This Pokemon gains the Charge effect when it takes a hit from an attack.
cobblemon.ability.embodyaspectcornerston: The Pokémon's heart fills with memories, causing the Cornerstone Mask to shine and the Pokémon's Defense stat to be boosted.
cobblemon.ability.embodyaspecthearthflam: The Pokémon's heart fills with memories, causing the Hearthflame Mask to shine and the Pokémon's Attack stat to be boosted.
cobblemon.ability.embodyaspectteal.desc: The Pokémon's heart fills with memories, causing the Teal Mask to shine and the Pokémon's Speed stat to be boosted.
cobblemon.ability.embodyaspectwellspring: The Pokémon's heart fills with memories, causing the Wellspring Mask to shine and the Pokémon's Sp. Def stat to be boosted.
cobblemon.ability.emergencyexit.desc: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
cobblemon.ability.fairyaura.desc: Powers up each Pokémon’s Fairy-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.filter.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
cobblemon.ability.flamebody.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.
cobblemon.ability.flareboost.desc: Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is burned.
cobblemon.ability.flashfire.desc: Powers up the Pokémon’s Fire-type moves if it’s hit by one.
cobblemon.ability.flowergift.desc: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies in harsh sunlight.
cobblemon.ability.flowerveil.desc: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.
cobblemon.ability.fluffy.desc: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.forecast.desc: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.
cobblemon.ability.forewarn.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.
cobblemon.ability.frisk.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.
cobblemon.ability.fullmetalbody.desc: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.
cobblemon.ability.furcoat.desc: Halves the damage from physical moves.
cobblemon.ability.galewings.desc: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is full.
cobblemon.ability.galvanize.desc: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.gluttony.desc: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.
cobblemon.ability.goodasgold.desc: This Pokemon is immune to Status moves.
cobblemon.ability.gooey.desc: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.
cobblemon.ability.gorillatactics.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.
cobblemon.ability.grasspelt.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat on Grassy Terrain.
cobblemon.ability.grassysurge.desc: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.grimneigh.desc: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a terrifying neigh, which boosts its Sp. Atk stat.
cobblemon.ability.guarddog.desc: This Pokemon is immune to the effect of the Intimidate Ability and raises its Attack by 1 stage instead. This Pokemon cannot be forced to switch out by another Pokemon's attack or item.
cobblemon.ability.gulpmissile.desc: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.
cobblemon.ability.guts.desc: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.hadronengine.desc: On switch-in, summons Electric Terrain. During Electric Terrain, Sp. Atk is 1.3333x.
cobblemon.ability.harvest.desc: May create another Berry after one is used.
cobblemon.ability.healer.desc: Sometimes heals an ally’s status condition.
cobblemon.ability.heatproof.desc: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.
cobblemon.ability.honeygather.desc: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.
cobblemon.ability.hospitality.desc: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it showers its ally with hospitality, restoring a small amount of the ally's HP
cobblemon.ability.hungerswitch.desc: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn.
cobblemon.ability.hustle.desc: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.
cobblemon.ability.hydration.desc: Heals status conditions if it’s raining.
cobblemon.ability.hypercutter.desc: The Pokémon’s proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.icebody.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.
cobblemon.ability.iceface.desc: The Pokémon’s ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon’s appearance. The ice will be restored when it hails.
cobblemon.ability.icescales.desc: The Pokémon is protected by ice scales, which halve the damage taken from special moves.
cobblemon.ability.illuminate.desc: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.
cobblemon.ability.illusion.desc: Comes out disguised as the Pokémon in the party’s last spot.
cobblemon.ability.immunity.desc: The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.
cobblemon.ability.imposter.desc: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it’s facing.
cobblemon.ability.infiltrator.desc: Passes through the opposing Pokémon’s barrier, substitute, and the like and strikes.
cobblemon.ability.innardsout.desc: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP.
cobblemon.ability.innerfocus.desc: The Pokémon’s intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.
cobblemon.ability.insomnia.desc: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.
cobblemon.ability.intimidate.desc: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.intrepidsword.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.ironbarbs.desc: Inflicts damage on the attacker upon contact with iron barbs.
cobblemon.ability.justified.desc: Being hit by a Dark-type move boosts the Attack stat of the Pokémon, for justice.
cobblemon.ability.keeneye.desc: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon’s accuracy.
cobblemon.ability.klutz.desc: The Pokémon can’t use any held items.
cobblemon.ability.leafguard.desc: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.
cobblemon.ability.levitate.desc: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.libero.desc: Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use.
cobblemon.ability.lightningrod.desc: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.
cobblemon.ability.limber.desc: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
cobblemon.ability.lingeringaroma.desc: Pokemon making contact with this Pokemon have their Ability changed to Lingering Aroma. Does not affect Pokemon with the As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Lingering Aroma, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero Abilities.
cobblemon.ability.liquidooze.desc: The oozed liquid has a strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.
cobblemon.ability.liquidvoice.desc: All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.longreach.desc: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.
cobblemon.ability.magicbounce.desc: Reflects status moves instead of getting hit by them.
cobblemon.ability.magicguard.desc: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.
cobblemon.ability.magician.desc: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.
cobblemon.ability.magmaarmor.desc: The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.
cobblemon.ability.magnetpull.desc: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.
cobblemon.ability.marvelscale.desc: The Pokémon’s marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.
cobblemon.ability.megalauncher.desc: Powers up aura and pulse moves.
cobblemon.ability.merciless.desc: The Pokémon’s attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.
cobblemon.ability.mimicry.desc: Changes the Pokémon’s type depending on the terrain.
cobblemon.ability.mindseye.desc: The Pokémon ignores changes to opponents' evasiveness, its accuracy can't be lowered, and it can hit Ghost types with Normal-type and Fighting-type moves
cobblemon.ability.minus.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
cobblemon.ability.mirrorarmor.desc: Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.
cobblemon.ability.mistysurge.desc: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.moldbreaker.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
cobblemon.ability.moody.desc: Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn.
cobblemon.ability.motordrive.desc: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.
cobblemon.ability.moxie.desc: The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.multiscale.desc: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.
cobblemon.ability.multitype.desc: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the Plate or Z-Crystal it holds.
cobblemon.ability.mummy.desc: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker’s Ability to Mummy.
cobblemon.ability.myceliummight.desc: This Pokemon's Status moves ignore certain Abilities of other Pokemon, and go last among Pokemon using the same or greater priority moves.
cobblemon.ability.naturalcure.desc: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.
cobblemon.ability.neuroforce.desc: Powers up moves that are super effective.
cobblemon.ability.neutralizinggas.desc: If the Pokémon with Neutralizing Gas is in the battle, the effects of all Pokémon’s Abilities will be nullified or will not be triggered.
cobblemon.ability.noguard.desc: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.
cobblemon.ability.normalize.desc: All the Pokémon’s moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.oblivious.desc: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.
cobblemon.ability.opportunist.desc: When an opposing Pokemon has a stat stage raised, this Pokemon copies the effect.
cobblemon.ability.orichalcumpulse.desc: On switch-in, summons Sunny Day. During Sunny Day, Attack is 1.3333x.
cobblemon.ability.overcoat.desc: Protects the Pokémon from things like sand, hail, and powder.
cobblemon.ability.overgrow.desc: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.
cobblemon.ability.owntempo.desc: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.
cobblemon.ability.pastelveil.desc: Protects the Pokémon and its ally Pokémon from being poisoned.
cobblemon.ability.perishbody.desc: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.
cobblemon.ability.pickpocket.desc: Steals an item from an attacker that made direct contact.
cobblemon.ability.pickup.desc: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.
cobblemon.ability.pixilate.desc: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.plus.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
cobblemon.ability.poisonheal.desc: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned instead of losing HP.
cobblemon.ability.poisonpoint.desc: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.
cobblemon.ability.poisontouch.desc: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.
cobblemon.ability.powerconstruct.desc: Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes half or less. Then the Pokémon changes its form to Complete Forme.
cobblemon.ability.powerofalchemy.desc: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.
cobblemon.ability.powerspot.desc: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.
cobblemon.ability.prankster.desc: Gives priority to a status move.
cobblemon.ability.pressure.desc: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.
cobblemon.ability.primordialsea.desc: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.
cobblemon.ability.prismarmor.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
cobblemon.ability.propellertail.desc: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s Abilities and moves that draw in moves.
cobblemon.ability.protean.desc: Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use.
cobblemon.ability.protosynthesis.desc: If Sunny Day is active or this Pokemon uses a held Booster Energy, this Pokemon's highest stat is multiplied by 1.3, or by 1.5 if the highest stat is Speed. Stat stage changes are considered at the time this Ability activates. If multiple stats are tied, Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed are prioritized in that order. If this effect was started by Sunny Day, a held Booster Energy will not activate and the effect ends when Sunny Day is no longer active. If this effect was started by a held Booster Energy, it ends when this Pokemon is no longer active.
cobblemon.ability.psychicsurge.desc: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.punkrock.desc: Boosts the power of sound-based moves. The Pokémon also takes half the damage from these kinds of moves.
cobblemon.ability.purepower.desc: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.
cobblemon.ability.purifyingsalt.desc: This Pokemon cannot become affected by a non-volatile status condition or Yawn. If a Pokemon uses a Ghost-type attack against this Pokemon, that Pokemon's offensive stat is halved when calculating the damage to this Pokemon.
cobblemon.ability.quarkdrive.desc: If Electric Terrain is active or this Pokemon uses a held Booster Energy, this Pokemon's highest stat is multiplied by 1.3, or by 1.5 if the highest stat is Speed. Stat stage changes are considered at the time this Ability activates. If multiple stats are tied, Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed are prioritized in that order. If this effect was started by Electric Terrain, a held Booster Energy will not activate and the effect ends when Electric Terrain is no longer active. If this effect was started by a held Booster Energy, it ends when this Pokemon is no longer active.
cobblemon.ability.queenlymajesty.desc: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
cobblemon.ability.quickdraw.desc: Enables the Pokémon to move first occasionally.
cobblemon.ability.quickfeet.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.
cobblemon.ability.raindish.desc: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.
cobblemon.ability.rattled.desc: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.
cobblemon.ability.receiver.desc: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.
cobblemon.ability.reckless.desc: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.
cobblemon.ability.refrigerate.desc: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.regenerator.desc: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.
cobblemon.ability.ripen.desc: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.
cobblemon.ability.rivalry.desc: Becomes competitive and deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but deals less to Pokémon of the opposite gender.
cobblemon.ability.rkssystem.desc: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the memory disc it holds.
cobblemon.ability.rockhead.desc: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.
cobblemon.ability.rockypayload.desc: This Pokemon's offensive stat is multiplied by 1.5 while using a Rock-type attack.
cobblemon.ability.roughskin.desc: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.
cobblemon.ability.runaway.desc: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.sandforce.desc: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
cobblemon.ability.sandrush.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a sandstorm.
cobblemon.ability.sandspit.desc: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it’s hit by an attack.
cobblemon.ability.sandstream.desc: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.sandveil.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in a sandstorm.
cobblemon.ability.sapsipper.desc: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move instead of taking damage.
cobblemon.ability.schooling.desc: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.
cobblemon.ability.scrappy.desc: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.screencleaner.desc: When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.seedsower.desc: When this Pokemon is hit by an attack, the effect of Grassy Terrain begins.
cobblemon.ability.serenegrace.desc: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.
cobblemon.ability.shadowshield.desc: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.
cobblemon.ability.shadowtag.desc: This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s shadow to prevent it from escaping.
cobblemon.ability.sharpness.desc: This Pokemon's slicing moves have their power multiplied by 1.5.
cobblemon.ability.shedskin.desc: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.
cobblemon.ability.sheerforce.desc: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.
cobblemon.ability.shellarmor.desc: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
cobblemon.ability.shielddust.desc: This Pokémon’s dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.
cobblemon.ability.shieldsdown.desc: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon’s shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.
cobblemon.ability.simple.desc: The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.
cobblemon.ability.skilllink.desc: Maximizes the number of times multistrike moves hit.
cobblemon.ability.slowstart.desc: For five turns, the Pokémon’s Attack and Speed stats are halved.
cobblemon.ability.slushrush.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a hailstorm.
cobblemon.ability.sniper.desc: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.
cobblemon.ability.snowwarning.desc: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.
cobblemon.ability.solarpower.desc: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in harsh sunlight, but HP decreases every turn.
cobblemon.ability.solidrock.desc: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
cobblemon.ability.soulheart.desc: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints.
cobblemon.ability.soundproof.desc: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.
cobblemon.ability.speedboost.desc: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.
cobblemon.ability.stakeout.desc: Doubles the damage dealt to the target’s replacement if the target switches out.
cobblemon.ability.stall.desc: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
cobblemon.ability.stalwart.desc: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s Abilities and moves that draw in moves.
cobblemon.ability.stamina.desc: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack.
cobblemon.ability.stancechange.desc: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King’s Shield.
cobblemon.ability.static.desc: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.
cobblemon.ability.steadfast.desc: The Pokémon’s determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.
cobblemon.ability.steamengine.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.
cobblemon.ability.steelyspirit.desc: Powers up ally Pokémon’s Steel-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.stench.desc: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.
cobblemon.ability.stickyhold.desc: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.stormdrain.desc: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.
cobblemon.ability.strongjaw.desc: The Pokémon’s strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.
cobblemon.ability.sturdy.desc: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.
cobblemon.ability.suctioncups.desc: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.
cobblemon.ability.superluck.desc: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.
cobblemon.ability.supersweetsyrup.desc: Lowers the evasion of opposing Pok�mon by 1 stage when first sent into battle
cobblemon.ability.supremeoverlord.desc: This Pokemon's moves have their power multiplied by 1+(X*0.1), where X is the total number of times any Pokemon has fainted on the user's side when this Ability became active, and X cannot be greater than 5.
cobblemon.ability.surgesurfer.desc: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat on Electric Terrain.
cobblemon.ability.swarm.desc: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.
cobblemon.ability.sweetveil.desc: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.
cobblemon.ability.swiftswim.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.
cobblemon.ability.swordofruin.desc: The Defense stat of all other active Pokemon is multiplied by 0.75.
cobblemon.ability.symbiosis.desc: The Pokémon passes its item to an ally that has used up an item.
cobblemon.ability.synchronize.desc: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.tabletsofruin.desc: The Attack stat of all other active Pokemon is multiplied by 0.75.
cobblemon.ability.tangledfeet.desc: Raises evasiveness if the Pokémon is confused.
cobblemon.ability.tanglinghair.desc: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.
cobblemon.ability.technician.desc: Powers up the Pokémon’s weaker moves.
cobblemon.ability.telepathy.desc: Anticipates an ally’s attack and dodges it.
cobblemon.ability.teraformzero.desc: When Terapagos changes into its Stellar Form, it uses its hidden powers to eliminate all effects of weather and terrain, reducing them to zero.
cobblemon.ability.terashell.desc: The Pokémon's shell contains the powers of each type. All damage-dealing moves that hit the Pokémon when its HP is full will not be very effective.
cobblemon.ability.terashift.desc: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it absorbs the energy around itself and transforms into its Terastal Form.
cobblemon.ability.teravolt.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
cobblemon.ability.thermalexchange.desc: This Pokemon's Attack is raised 1 stage after it is damaged by a Fire-type move. This Pokemon cannot be burned. Gaining this Ability while burned cures it.
cobblemon.ability.thickfat.desc: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.
cobblemon.ability.tintedlens.desc: The Pokémon can use “not very effective” moves to deal regular damage.
cobblemon.ability.torrent.desc: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.
cobblemon.ability.toughclaws.desc: Powers up moves that make direct contact.
cobblemon.ability.toxicboost.desc: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.
cobblemon.ability.toxicchain.desc: The power of the Pokémon's toxic chain may badly poison any target the Pok�mon hits with a move
cobblemon.ability.toxicdebris.desc: If this Pokémon is hit by a physical attack, Toxic Spikes are set on the opposing side.
cobblemon.ability.trace.desc: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon’s Ability.
cobblemon.ability.triage.desc: Gives priority to a healing move.
cobblemon.ability.truant.desc: The Pokémon can’t use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn.
cobblemon.ability.turboblaze.desc: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
cobblemon.ability.unaware.desc: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon’s stat changes.
cobblemon.ability.unburden.desc: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon’s held item is used or lost.
cobblemon.ability.unnerve.desc: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.
cobblemon.ability.unseenfist.desc: If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.
cobblemon.ability.vesselofruin.desc: The Special Attack stat of all other active Pokemon is multiplied by 0.75.
cobblemon.ability.victorystar.desc: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.
cobblemon.ability.vitalspirit.desc: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.
cobblemon.ability.voltabsorb.desc: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.
cobblemon.ability.wanderingspirit.desc: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.
cobblemon.ability.waterabsorb.desc: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.
cobblemon.ability.waterbubble.desc: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
cobblemon.ability.watercompaction.desc: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.
cobblemon.ability.waterveil.desc: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
cobblemon.ability.weakarmor.desc: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.
cobblemon.ability.wellbakedbody.desc: This Pokemon is immune to Fire-type moves and raises its Defense by 2 stages when hit by a Fire-type move.
cobblemon.ability.whitesmoke.desc: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
cobblemon.ability.wimpout.desc: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
cobblemon.ability.windpower.desc: This Pokemon gains the Charge effect when it takes a hit from a wind move or when Tailwind begins on this Pokemon's side.
cobblemon.ability.windrider.desc: This Pokemon is immune to wind moves and raises its Attack by 1 stage when hit by a wind move or when Tailwind begins on this Pokemon's side.
cobblemon.ability.wonderguard.desc: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.wonderskin.desc: Makes status moves more likely to miss.
cobblemon.ability.zenmode.desc: Changes the Pokémon’s shape when HP is half or less.
cobblemon.ability.zerotohero.desc: If this Pokemon is a Palafin in Zero Form, switching out has it change to Hero Form.
